title: plagiarism avoider
original_prompt: In a tone that matches the original text in length, formality, and clarity, rewrite the following text to paraphrase each idea presented but without plagiarising the original authors.  Be specific and include all information presented.  Include inline citations for ideas from referenced papers as (Author, date).  Also include list of cited refs at end.
input1: The rapid advancement of technology has significantly transformed the landscape of education, enabling more personalized learning experiences for students (Smith, 2020). Online platforms and digital resources have made it easier for learners to access information and engage with content at their own pace (Johnson, 2019). Furthermore, the integration of artificial intelligence in educational tools has the potential to tailor instruction to meet individual needs, thereby enhancing overall learning outcomes (Lee, 2021).
input2:
Recent developments in technology have profoundly impacted the educational sector, allowing for customized learning opportunities for students (Brown, 2022). Digital tools and online resources have facilitated greater access to knowledge, enabling learners to interact with materials according to their own schedules (Davis, 2021). Additionally, the use of machine learning in educational applications can adapt teaching methods to suit the unique requirements of each student, which may lead to improved academic performance (Garcia, 2023). 

References:
- Smith, J. (2020). The impact of technology on education. Journal of Educational Technology.
- Johnson, L. (2019). Online learning and student engagement. International Review of Education.
- Lee, A. (2021). Artificial intelligence in education: Opportunities and challenges. Educational Research Review.
- Brown, T. (2022). Customizing education through technology. Journal of Modern Education.
- Davis, R. (2021). Access to knowledge in the digital age. Global Education Review.
- Garcia, M. (2023). Machine learning and personalized education. Journal of Educational Innovation.
